message_1: Consider the proposition: "If I study for more than 5 hours today, then I will ace my math test tomorrow." Write the truth table for this proposition.
message_2:
Let P represent "I study for more than 5 hours today" and Q represent "I will ace my math test tomorrow." The proposition can be written as "If P, then Q" or "P → Q". The truth table for this proposition is as follows:

P | Q | P → Q
--------------
T | T |   T
T | F |   F
F | T |   T
F | F |   T

Here, T represents true and F represents false.
